OOC: Sorry for not posting lately!

Tyrael looked at the defying robot. Of course, this was a quality he 
looked forward to exploit. He would make a great leader... after him. 
The only important thing was to be sure to have the black one on his 
side.

Tyrael: I am glad to see you too, Shadow Star. I am here to give you a 
command. As you might know, I have been given Gorefeast's position. As 
such, I am about to embark on a mission, and the council has given me 
free choice of my crew. I want you as my second in command. Do you 
agree?

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "dewboy30816" <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> Shadow Star opened the door.  He gave an almost challengin bow.
> 
> Shadow Star: What do my (almost joking with the word) superiors 
> desire of me?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> >   OOC: Dewboy, have you read the Reward for incompetence post?
> >   
> >   Tyrael thought back to the ceremony of the execution. The robot 
> he 
> > had looked at right after was Bleeder, Shadow Star's superior 
> officer. 
> > They had both talked, and Tyrael had explained his reason's for 
his 
> > choice. Bleeder had been in agreement. Now, Tyrael had to announce 
> it 
> > to the principal interested...
> >   He went to the junior officer's quarters. He hoped the young 
> officer 
> > was there. After searching for a few minutes, he found the bot's 
> door, 
> > and pressed the button announcing him.
> >   Tyrael: I am Colonel Tyrael. I have come to meet with you, 
Shadow 
> > Star.
